convoy looting")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi (December)](/wiki/4_December_2024_al-Mawasi_attack "4 December 2024 al-Mawasi attack")<br>    <br>*   [Nuseirat (December)](/wiki/December_2024_Nuseirat_refugee_camp_attack "December 2024 Nuseirat refugee camp attack")<br>    <br>*   [March 2025 Israeli strikes](/wiki/March_2025_Israeli_attacks_on_the_Gaza_Strip "March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip")<br>    <br>*   [Rafah paramedic massacre](/wiki/Rafah_paramedic_massacre "Rafah paramedic massacre")<br>    <br>*   [April 2025 Shuja'iyya](/wiki/April_2025_Shuja%27iyya_airstrike "April 2025 Shuja'iyya airstrike")<br>    <br>*   [Gaza European Hospital](/wiki/2025_Gaza_European_Hospital_strikes "2025 Gaza European Hospital strikes")<br>    <br>*   [Killing of al-Najjar children](/wiki/Killing_of_al-Najjar_children "Killing of al-Najjar children")<br>    <br>*   [Fahmi al-Jarjawi school](/wiki/Fahmi_al-Jarjawi_School_Massacre "Fahmi al-Jarjawi School Massacre")<br>    <br>*   [2025 Gaza Strip aid distribution killings](/wiki/2025_Gaza_Strip_aid_distribution_killings "2025 Gaza Strip aid distribution killings")<br>    <br>*   [Al-Baqa Cafe](/wiki/Al-Baqa_Cafe_airstrike "Al-Baqa Cafe airstrike")<br>    <br>*   [2025 Nasser Hospital strikes](/wiki/2025_Nasser_Hospital_strikes "2025 Nasser Hospital strikes")<br>    <br><br>* * *<br><br>[War crimes and effects](/wiki/War_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "War crimes in the Gaza war")<br><br>*   [War crimes and crimes against humanity report](/wiki/Diplomatic_impact_of_the_Gaza_war#Independent_International_Commission_of_Inquiry_on_the_Occupied_Palestinian_Territory_report "Diplomatic impact of the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Palestinian war crimes](/wiki/Palestinian_war_crimes "Palestinian war crimes")<br>    *   [Hostage crisis](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")<br>        *   [2023 prisoner exchange](/wiki/2023_Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_prisoner_exchange "2023 Israeli–Palestinian prisoner exchange")<br>            <br>*   [Israeli war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")<br>    *   [Israeli blockade of Gaza](/wiki/Israeli_blockade_of_the_Gaza_Strip_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Israeli blockade of the Gaza Strip (2023–present)")<br>        *   [Famine](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_famine "Gaza Strip famine")<br>            <br>    *   [AI-assisted targeting](/wiki/AI-assisted_targeting_in_the_Gaza_Strip "AI-assisted targeting in the Gaza Strip")<br>        <br>    *   [Mass detentions](/wiki/Mass_detentions_in_the_Gaza_war "Mass detentions in the Gaza war")<br>        <br>    *   [South Africa v. It began on 5 October 2024 when the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 (IDF) reinvaded [Jabalia](/wiki/Jabalia "Jabalia")
 and [its refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
 for the first time in months since [earlier fighting](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
[\[9\]](#cite_note-bbc.com-9)

The siege was reportedly part of Israel's "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
" to force Palestinians out of northern Gaza by designating it a combat zone and issuing [evacuation orders](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 to civilians under threat of death.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 The IDF imposed a complete siege on northern Gaza, cutting it off from [Gaza City](/wiki/Gaza_City "Gaza City")
 by destroying most of the roads leading south and preventing the [entry of aid](/wiki/Humanitarian_aid_during_the_Gaza_war "Humanitarian aid during the Gaza war")
.[\[20\]](#cite_note-Stray_dogs-20)
[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)
 Evacuations were hindered, however, by [Israeli bombardments](/wiki/Israeli_bombing_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip")
 and [shootings of fleeing civilians](/wiki/Attacks_on_protected_zones_and_civilians_in_Gaza "Attacks on protected zones and civilians in Gaza")
, leaving many trapped.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 Human rights groups raised concerns of [war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")
, and Israeli actions were characterized as ethnic cleansing and [genocide](/wiki/Gaza_genocide "Gaza genocide")
.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-24)
 Israel [attacked hospitals](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
 and [medical infrastructure](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
, as international bodies warned of disastrous conditions in Jabalia.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)

Israel's siege extended to Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun, with officials stating no food had been allowed to enter either town or Jabalia.[\[26\]](#cite_note-26)
 A senior [COGAT](/wiki/Coordinator_of_Government_Activities_in_the_Territories "Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories")
 official stated that aid delivery was being confined to Gaza City because there was "no population" remaining in Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun.[\[27\]](#cite_note-27)

A [ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire "2025 Gaza war ceasefire")
 between Israel and Hamas came into effect on 19 January 2025, with the IDF withdrawing from northern Gaza to a buffer zone along the [Gaza Strip–Israel border](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_barrier "Gaza–Israel barrier")
 on that same day.[\[28\]](#cite_note-:5-28)

Background
----------

Further information: [Battle of Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Battle_of_Beit_Hanoun "Battle of Beit Hanoun")
 and [Battle of Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")

Fighting between Palestinian militants and the IDF had taken place in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")
 and Jabalia since 27 October 2023 and 8 November 2023, respectively.[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 The IDF also launched raids into [Beit Lahia](/wiki/Beit_Lahia "Beit Lahia")
 such as the [Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
 in December 2024 and May 2024.[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)
[\[31\]](#cite_note-31)
[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)

The IDF encountered "significant resistance" during the [fighting in Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 and ultimately failed to dismantle Hamas' presence in the city.[\[33\]](#cite_note-:6-33)

On 31 May 2024, the IDF withdrew from North Gaza, including both Beit Hanoun and Jabalia.[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)
[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)

In the four months since the Israeli withdrawal, Hamas reportedly reconstituted itself in Jabalia and managed to recruit thousands of new fighters in the area.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 Hamas also planted explosives in almost all buildings in Jabalia, sometimes even causing the death of its own militants.[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)

Siege
-----

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg/250px-Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)](/wiki/File:Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)

Israeli soldiers inspecting a [Merkava](/wiki/Merkava "Merkava")
 that was destroyed by Hamas in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")

### Jabalia

On the evening of 5 October,[\[4\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification1-4)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification2-5)
 the IDF began its stated operation to dismantle Hamas control in Jabalia, with the [Israeli Air Force](/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force "Israeli Air Force")
 launching strikes around the area while armored brigades encircled the [Jabalia refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)

The IDF advanced into Jabalia and were met by combined attacks from Hamas, [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
 (PIJ), [al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades](/wiki/Al-Aqsa_Martyrs%27_Brigades "Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades")
, and the [Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine](/wiki/Popular_Front_for_the_Liberation_of_Palestine "Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine")
 (PFLP).[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 PIJ launched an attack on an Israeli [command and control room](/wiki/Command_center "Command center")
 belonging to forces attempting to penetrate the Jabalia refugee camp.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)

On 10 October, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)
[\[39\]](#cite_note-39)
[\[40\]](#cite_note-40)
 The IDF said that an Israeli airstrike on a Hamas command and control centre killed at least 12 Hamas and PIJ commanders.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)

On 13 October, Israeli prime minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 stated that the IDF had reached "the heart of Jabalia" and were dismantling Hamas strongholds there. He is considered to have been the highest-ranking officer to have died in ground combat since the start of the Gaza war.[\[45\]](#cite_note-45)
[\[46\]](#cite_note-46)

On 22 October, Hamas said that its fighters detonated an explosive device targeting 12 Israeli soldiers in the Jabalia refugee camp, killing and wounding some of them.[\[47\]](#cite_note-47)

On 17 November, Israeli media reported that that IDF soldiers preparing an ambush in southern Jabalia were themselves ambushed by Hamas fighters.[\[48\]](#cite_note-48)

On 20 December, a Hamas fighter carried out a suicide bombing against an IDF position in the Jabalia camp.[\[49\]](#cite_note-49)

On 30 December, Palestinian militants carried out a "relatively large attack" in multiple waves against IDF positions around the Jabalia camp.[\[50\]](#cite_note-50)

### Beit Lahia

On 11 October, clashes between the IDF and Hamas were reported to be taking place in Beit Lahia.[\[51\]](#cite_note-51)
 Palestinian health officials stated on 27 October that Israeli strikes had killed at least 87 people.[\[52\]](#cite_note-52)
 On 28 October, an Israeli attack on the Beit Lahia residential square reportedly killed 45 people, with more than 30 trapped under the rubble.[\[53\]](#cite_note-53)
 After residents of Jabalia fled to Beit Lahia, the IDF then reportedly turned their attention to the town.[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)
 Sam Rose, a UN official, stated, "People who fled to Beit Lahiya have themselves been bombed".[\[55\]](#cite_note-55)
 Beit Lahia declared a state of emergency due to Israel's siege and attacks, stating, "We declare that the city is a disaster area due to the Israeli war of extermination and siege, and it has no food, water, hospitals, doctors, services, or communications".[\[56\]](#cite_note-56)

Five people were reportedly killed by Israeli airstrikes in Beit Lahia on 1 November.[\[57\]](#cite_note-57)
 Rescue teams were also attacked, with three members hit by a drone, while the civil defence stated an Israeli tank destroyed their only fire truck.[\[58\]](#cite_note-58)
 At least twenty people were reportedly killed during an attack on 4 November, with video showing residents pulling bodies out of the rubble.[\[59\]](#cite_note-59)

On 23 December, Hamas said that some of its fighters stormed an IDF position at a building in Beit Lahia and managed to free several Palestinians who had been detained inside.[\[60\]](#cite_note-60)

### Beit Hanoun

In Beit Hanoun, the IDF conducted bombings on the night of 11–12 November and targeted fleeing civilians with drones and sniper fire the next day.[\[61\]](#cite_note-61)
 The IDF besieged some 130 families in a shelter in the city and forced them to leave at gunpoint.[\[62\]](#cite_note-62)

Despite claiming to have “dismantled Hamas” in Beit Hanoun, Israeli forces who entered the abandoned city on 23 December were immediately ambushed by militants. We can’t get out."[\[80\]](#cite_note-80)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/NetzarimCorridor.jpg/330px-NetzarimCorridor.jpg)](/wiki/File:NetzarimCorridor.jpg)

Approximate location of the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
.

According to Israeli media, tens of thousands of Palestinians have passed through the IDF security crossing at the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
 to get to the southern Gaza Strip.[\[41\]](#cite_note-:3-41)
 On 7 October 2024, however, UN Spokesperson [Stéphane Dujarric](/wiki/St%C3%A9phane_Dujarric "Stéphane Dujarric")
 stated many people in northern Gaza were "trapped" in their homes and that "few families have crossed Wadi Gaza heading South".[\[81\]](#cite_note-81)
 [Doctors Without Borders](/wiki/Doctors_Without_Borders "Doctors Without Borders")
 stated at least five of their staff members were trapped in Jabalia, stating, "Nobody is allowed to get in or out; anyone who tries is getting shot".[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 head [Philippe Lazzarini](/wiki/Philippe_Lazzarini "Philippe Lazzarini")
 stated, "People attempting to flee are getting killed, their bodies left on the street".[\[82\]](#cite_note-82)

Anas al-Sharif, a journalist on the ground, stated that possibly thousands of families were "trapped between tanks, their gunfire, and heavy artillery shelling".[\[83\]](#cite_note-83)
 One woman stated she was forced from her home "at gunpoint" as tanks and heavily armed soldiers encircled her family, and that young men were separated for interrogation.[\[84\]](#cite_note-84)
 Another woman stated that in Jabalia, a quadcopter told residents: "Don't think of north Gaza ever again."[\[85\]](#cite_note-Under_deadly_Israeli_siege-85)
 Israeli footage showed men separated at checkpoints in northern Gaza and possibly detained.[\[86\]](#cite_note-86)
 The Israeli military released footage of Palestinians being rounded up near the besieged Indonesia Hospital, where they had been sheltering.[\[87\]](#cite_note-87)
[\[88\]](#cite_note-88)
 Residents stated Israeli forced stormed shelters for displaced families and detained men, with footage showing men sitting next to a tank while others were led away by a soldier.[\[89\]](#cite_note-89)
 The UN Human Rights Office stated it was concerned the men could be subject to arbitrary detainment and torture.[\[90\]](#cite_note-90)

### Targeting of civilians

Per the [Palestinian Civil Defense](/wiki/Palestinian_Civil_Defence "Palestinian Civil Defence")
, at least 17 people, including 9 children, were killed in the IDF's initial wave of airstrikes.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)
 One of those killed was journalist Hassan Hamad, who was reportedly deliberately targeted by Israel after receiving threats via messages and calls from Israeli officers, ordering him to stop his reporting.[\[91\]](#cite_note-91)
 After an Israeli airstrike on 11 October that killed at least 22 Palestinians and wounded more than 90, Hamas made a statement the following day condemning what it described as the "[Nazi](/wiki/Nazism "Nazism")
 occupation’s massacres" in Jabalia under [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")
 protection.[\[92\]](#cite_note-92)
 Journalists stated they were being directly targeted by the Israeli army, including Fadi Al Wahidi, who was reportedly shot in the neck by a sniper.[\[93\]](#cite_note-93)

On 14 October, [Al Jazeera Arabic](/wiki/Al_Jazeera_Arabic "Al Jazeera Arabic")
 reported the Israeli military was planting explosives in homes to demolish them.[\[94\]](#cite_note-94)
 The same day, medics reported that Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for flour at a food distribution centre, killing ten people and wounding dozens.[\[95\]](#cite_note-95)
 On 16 October, the Gaza Civil Defense stated there were dozens of people trapped under the rubble, and some bodies were laying in the road unable to be rescued.[\[96\]](#cite_note-96)
 Gaza's civil defence agency spokesman stated, "There are a number of pleas from families being bombed inside Jabalia camp... The remaining soldiers were then attacked by Hamas militants who opened fire on them before withdrawing, wounding a further six.[\[70\]](#cite_note-70)

Evacuation and attacks on civilians
-----------------------------------

### Generals' plan

Main article: [Israeli generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")

On 6 October 2024, Israel designated all of the northern Gaza Strip as a combat zone and ordered the entire civilian population to evacuate.[\[71\]](#cite_note-71)
[\[72\]](#cite_note-72)
 Both Israeli military analysts and the [Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights](/wiki/Al-Mezan_Center_for_Human_Rights "Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights")
 alleged that this was the first stage of the "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
", a policy proposed by former Israeli general [Giora Eiland](/wiki/Giora_Eiland "Giora Eiland")
 to force Palestinians out of Gaza on pain of death.[\[73\]](#cite_note-73)
 The Israeli human rights organizations [Gisha](/wiki/Gisha_(human_rights_organization) "Gisha (human rights organization)")
, [B'Tselem](/wiki/B%27Tselem "B'Tselem")
, [Physicians for Human Rights](/wiki/Physicians_for_Human_Rights%E2%80%93Israel "Physicians for Human Rights–Israel")
 and [Yesh Din](/wiki/Yesh_Din "Yesh Din")
 stated there were "alarming signs" that Israel was implementing the plan.[\[74\]](#cite_note-74)
 Three Israeli reserve soldiers in Gaza stated it was their understanding the general's plan was being practically implemented.[\[75\]](#cite_note-75)
 The plan has been described by Hamas as [genocidal](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")
.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 Others have described the plan as the [ethnic cleansing](/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing "Ethnic cleansing")
 of northern Gaza.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
 The United Nations warned that Israel was not allowing food to enter northern Gaza or Jabalia.[\[76\]](#cite_note-76)
[\[77\]](#cite_note-77)

On 7 October, the IDF issued evacuation orders for residents of Jabalia, Beit Hanoun, and Beit Lahia, instructing them to travel southwards to the [al-Mawasi humanitarian zone](/wiki/Al-Mawasi,_Rafah "Al-Mawasi, Rafah")
.[\[78\]](#cite_note-78)
 Following these evacuation orders was made more difficult by Israel's ongoing bombardment, as well as drones pursuing and shooting at individuals attempting to flee.[\[79\]](#cite_note-79)
 Residents reported being trapped in Jabalia, with all roads blocked except the main highway leading out. Then, they stormed the area with their tanks and opened fire randomly."[\[105\]](#cite_note-105)
 At least 87 people were killed by an [airstrike in Beit Lahia](/wiki/October_2024_Beit_Lahia_attacks "October 2024 Beit Lahia attacks")
.[\[106\]](#cite_note-106)

On 21 October, 10 people were reportedly killed and 30 wounded by an Israeli attack at the Jabalia Preparatory School turned shelter.[\[107\]](#cite_note-107)
 A paramedic fleeing the shelter stated that people were attempting to comply with an evacuation order when "suddenly there was shelling".[\[108\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[109\]](#cite_note-109)
 On 23 October, civil defence teams stated they were attempting to rescue people buried under rubble by hand.[\[110\]](#cite_note-110)
 The same day, three civil defense workers were wounded in a "targeted strike" by Israel, leading the agency to suspend operations in northern Gaza.[\[111\]](#cite_note-111)
 Israeli forces also reportedly killed northern Gaza's chief of police.[\[112\]](#cite_note-112)
 The civil defense reported 150 people were killed and injured in an airstrike on Jabalia's Block 7 on 24 October.[\[113\]](#cite_note-113)
 Dozens were killed by Israeli strikes on residences in Beit Lahia on 26 October.[\[114\]](#cite_note-114)
 As many as 93 people were killed by an [Israeli airstrike on Beit Lahia](/wiki/29_October_2024_Beit_Lahia_strike "29 October 2024 Beit Lahia strike")
 on 29 October.[\[115\]](#cite_note-115)

On 1 November 2024, the Gaza Government Media Office reported two Israeli airstrikes on residential buildings killed 84 people, including 50 children.[\[116\]](#cite_note-116)
 The civil defense stated they were unable to reach the site and residents were attempting rescues.[\[117\]](#cite_note-117)
 Women evacuating from Jabalia stated the Israeli army forced them into holes, where dust was thrown on them as an intimidation tactic.[\[118\]](#cite_note-118)

Dr. stated Israel had "failed to implement" their recommendations, and that it would "follow the law" if Israel did not comply by its deadline.[\[135\]](#cite_note-135)

### Hospitals and healthcare

During the siege, the Health Ministry stated Israel was "intensifying its targeting of the health system in the northern Gaza Strip".[\[103\]](#cite_note-Israeli_air_strike_kills_33-103)
 WHO's vaccination campaign to address Gaza's [polio epidemic](/wiki/2024_Gaza_Strip_polio_epidemic "2024 Gaza Strip polio epidemic")
 was delayed in northern Gaza due to the escalating violence and intense bombing.[\[136\]](#cite_note-136)
 On 9 October, an Israeli airstrike killed at least 15 people inside Al-Yemen Al-Saeed Hospital in Jabalia, which has housed displaced families.[\[137\]](#cite_note-137)
 Israel reportedly used a "double tap" bombing, injuring fifteen people in a family home, then targeted an ambulance arriving to help them, killing a doctor.[\[138\]](#cite_note-138)

The Gaza Health Ministry stated Israel had besieged and was directly targeting the [Indonesia Hospital](/wiki/Indonesia_Hospital "Indonesia Hospital")
, Kamal Adwan Hospital, and [Al-Awda Hospital](/wiki/Al-Awda_Hospital "Al-Awda Hospital")
.[\[139\]](#cite_note-139)
 More than 350 patients were reportedly trapped in the three hospitals, including pregnant women, people with chronic health conditions, and individuals needing surgeries.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)
 The Al Awda hospital stated Israeli strikes on the hospital and an ambulance had wounded several medical staff.[\[140\]](#cite_note-140)
 In a statement, the director of Al-Awda Hospital stated, "Israeli forces are targeting everything that moves in northern Gaza".[\[141\]](#cite_note-141)

#### Indonesia Hospital

The Indonesia Hospital's director stated, "Israeli tanks have completely surrounded the hospital, cut off electricity and shelled the hospital, targeting the second and third floors with artillery".[\[142\]](#cite_note-142)
 Staff reported heavy gunfire directed at the hospital, with more than 40 patients injured.[\[143\]](#cite_note-143)
 Two patients at Indonesia Hospital were reported to have died after the hospital lost electricity, as the UN stated the Indonesia Hospital was no longer operational.[\[144\]](#cite_note-144)
[\[145\]](#cite_note-145)
 Indonesia Hospital's chief nurse stated the hospital's water supply had been cut, that operating the electric generator required permission from the IDF, and there was no food available for four consecutive days.[\[146\]](#cite_note-146)
 On 21 October 2024, medics at Indonesia Hospital stated Israeli forces set a nearby school on fire, which spread to the hospital and shut down its power.[\[147\]](#cite_note-147)

#### Kamal Adwan Hospital

On 25 October 2024, Israel launched [a raid of Kamal Adwan Hospital](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges#October_and_November_2024 "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
.[\[148\]](#cite_note-148)
 The Palestinian health ministry stated 600 patients, companions, and staff were trapped.[\[149\]](#cite_note-149)
 The following day, the [World Health Organization](/wiki/World_Health_Organization "World Health Organization")
 stated that while the hospital was still under siege, it had regained contact with its employees there, stating that four employees were injured, 44 health workers had been detained, and four ambulances were damaged.[\[150\]](#cite_note-150)
 The Gaza Ministry of Health stated that Israeli forces had detained all male medical staff.[\[151\]](#cite_note-151)
 On 27 October, Dr. Retrieved 2025-01-22.

Retrieved from "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Siege\_of\_North\_Gaza&oldid=1307670532](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Siege_of_North_Gaza&oldid=1307670532)
"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Siege of North Gaza" mentions the "Siege of North Gaza" which began on October 5, 2024, and included fighting in Jabalia. The article also mentions an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp. The article also mentions the Abu Hussein school attack on October 17, 2024.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
image_search("burning tank Israeli army")
geolocate(<image:34>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
Sky News shows an image of a burning tank (<image:8744>). The search result from vpk.name shows a burning tank (<image:8745>). The source discusses an old photo that is being circulated as showing the destruction of an Israeli military tank in Shamaa, south of Lebanon (<image:8746>).

The sources are:
*   [https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835](https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835)
*   [https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html](https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html)
*   [https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/)


### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Pakistan': 0.11, 'Palestine': 0.11, 'Israel': 0.1, 'Tunisia': 0.09, 'Mexico': 0.06, 'Colombia': 0.05, 'Chile': 0.04, 'Sweden': 0.03, 'Argentina': 0.02, 'Denmark': 0.02}

## Elaboration
The image search results show other images of burning tanks, including one from Sky News. One source discusses an old photo being circulated as showing the destruction of an Israeli military tank in Shamaa, south of Lebanon. The geolocation data suggests the image could have been taken in Palestine or Israel.

The evidence does not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024. The evidence does not provide the date or location of the image.


## Actions
```
web_search("Hamas ambush Israeli tank Jabalia October 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-tanks-push-deeper-into-jabalia-northern-gaza-residents-say-2024-10-08/): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

[Exclusive news, data and analytics for financial market professionalsLearn more aboutRefinitiv](/differentiator/)

*   Summary

*   Israeli army issues new evacuation orders for Jabalia
*   Israel says it is trying to stop militants regrouping
*   Palestinian medics report casualties in latest fighting

CAIRO, Oct 8 (Reuters) - Israel sent tanks deeper into Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip on Tuesday and advised people to leave as it pounded the historic Palestinian refugee camp from the air, residents said.

Palestinian medics said casualties had been reported in Jabalia but they were unable to reach areas under fire.

Sign up [here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=%2Fworld%2Fmiddle-east%2Fisraeli-tanks-push-deeper-into-jabalia-northern-gaza-residents-say-2024-10-08%2F)

Israel's army has said its forces are trying to stop fighters from the Hamas militant group staging further attacks from Jabalia and want to prevent them regrouping.

"Jabalia is being wiped out," was repeated in many messages posted on social media by residents of Gaza, who on Monday marked the first anniversary of the [Israel-Hamas war](https://www.reuters.com/world/israel-hamas/)
, triggered by the Hamas attack on southern Israel on Oct. Fewer than half of Gaza's hospitals remain even partially functioning after a year of Israeli bombardments.

Smoke rises in northern Gaza, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, as seen from Israel, October 7, 2024. Hamas denies this.

The armed wings of Hamas and Islamic Jihad said fighters had attacked Israeli forces in the north with anti-tank rockets, and that there were casualties among the Israeli troops.

The Israeli military said it had killed many Palestinian militants, located weapons and dismantled military infrastructure in its operations in Jabalia.

Reuters was unable to verify the battlefield reports.

Israel began its offensive after Hamas-led militants stormed across the border into southern Israeli communities on Oct. Israel's military said one soldier had been killed in combat in northern Gaza.

Later in the day, the Israeli military said it had detected and intercepted two launches of projectiles crossing Gaza, shortly after Hamas' smaller ally Islamic Jihad said it had fired rockets towards Sderot in nearby southern Israel.

In Gaza, the Israeli army issued new evacuation orders to residents of Jabalia and nearby Beit Hanoun and Beit Lahiya, telling them to head to a humanitarian-designated zone in Al-Mawasi in the south of the crowded coastal enclave.

The Indonesia, Kamal Adwan and Al-Awda hospitals in northern Gaza have also been asked to evacuate in the past 48 hours, World Health Organization officials told a briefing in Cairo. officials say there are no completely safe places in Gaza.

"Jabalia is being bombed as if the war has just begun and the world is blind about it," said Salah, 60, a father of five who is a resident of Gaza City.

"We live at least seven kilometres away, but the sounds of Israeli airstrikes and tank shelling deprive us of sleep. The world must stop Israeli crimes," he said via a chat app.

Israel, which is also in [conflict with Hezbollah](/world/middle-east/hezbollah-strikes-israel-gaza-war-anniversary-fears-grow-over-middle-east-2024-10-07/)
 in Lebanon, says Hamas militants use residential areas as cover in the densely populated territory, including schools and hospitals. 7, 2023, killing 1,200 people and taking about 250 hostage, according to Israeli tallies.

Israel's ensuing offensive in Gaza has killed nearly 42,000 Palestinians, the enclave's health ministry says. Most of Gaza's 2.3 million people have been displaced and humanitarian conditions have deteriorated sharply.

Reporting by Nidal al-Mughrabi; additional reporting by Aidan Lewis, Nayera Abdallah and Jaidaa Taha; editing by Timothy Heritage and Mark Heinrich

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

The Palestinian Civil Defence spokesperson in Gaza, Mahmoud Basal, added that Jabalia was targeted with multiple strikes overnight, resulting in many casualties. It felt like the early days of the war,” Raed, 52, from Jabalia, told the Reuters news agency before his family left for Gaza City on Sunday.

On Sunday morning, the Israeli military said its forces had “successfully” encircled the refugee camp and were operating in the area.

The army said the decision was taken after intelligence indicated the “presence of terrorists and terror infrastructure in the area of Jabalia … as well as efforts by Hamas to rebuild its operational capabilities in the area”.

Israel has destroyed hospitals, schools and residential areas, claiming Hamas was operating under them but providing no proof of its claims. This may lead to more civilian deaths and injuries,” he said.

Military and security analyst Elijah Magnier says Israel’s renewed ground invasion of northern Gaza was “inevitable” as far-right Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich claimed that Palestinian armed resistance groups had recruited “more than a thousand people”.

“Israelis have returned to Gaza several times, they’ve returned to the north several times, they’ve destroyed the infrastructure, the hospitals, everything,” Magnier told Al Jazeera.

“They will continue doing so unless \[Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin\] Netanyahu stops this war.”

![INTERACTIVE-Israeli -evacuation order-north gaza- October 6, 2024-1728203089](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/INTERACTIVE-Israeli-evacuation-order-north-gaza-October-6-2024-1728203089.png?w=770&resize=770%2C962&quality=80)

(Al Jazeera)

Evacuation orders
-----------------

The Israeli army has called on Palestinians in northern Gaza to flee to designated “safe zones” in southern and central Gaza as it begins a renewed ground offensive. Residents in Jabalia have described the intensified attacks as some of the worst in months.

“Dozens of explosions from air strikes and tank shelling shook the ground and buildings. Rights organisations say these attacks amount to war crimes.

Meanwhile, the armed wing of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad has said its fighters have targeted “a command and control room” belonging to Israeli forces who were trying to get into Jabalia refugee camp.

‘Deteriorating’ situation
-------------------------

Reporting from near the Kamal Adwan Hospital in Jabalia, journalist Moath al-Kahlout said that the situation in the north was “deteriorating”, adding that an “entire family” had been killed in the overnight attacks.

“The Israeli army dropped leaflets on the Jabalia refugee camp ordering people to flee their homes, and this alarming development suggests that the Israeli army is preparing for further attacks. But no place in Gaza is safe for Palestinians, including the so-called “safe zones”, campaigners say.

But as some Palestinians begin making the journey southwards, Gaza’s Interior Ministry has called on residents to ignore Israel’s evacuation orders.

“Israeli claims about the presence of safe zones in southern Gaza are lies as Israel commits crimes and massacres in all areas of the enclave,” the ministry said in a statement.

“We call on citizens in northern Gaza to ignore Israeli threats.”

Reporting from Deir el-Balah in central Gaza, Al Jazeera’s Hind Khoudary said the difference this time, compared to earlier evacuation orders, is that it is “not only blocks but whole areas”.

“Some of those Palestinians who were in the north have refused to evacuate despite the attacks and also the starvation and harsh conditions the blockade has imposed on them. They still refuse to leave,” Khoudary said.

She added that a member of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) was also targeted in Sunday’s strikes and was killed.

According to Gaza’s Health Ministry, at least 41,870 Palestinians have been killed and 97,166 others injured since the war began on October 7.

Source: Al Jazeera and news agencies

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

The Wikipedia article mentions an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. Reuters and Al Jazeera also report on the fighting in Jabalia, including tank deployments.

While the evidence confirms that there was fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including tank deployments and an ambush, it does not confirm that the image depicts the specific event described in the claim. The evidence does not provide any information about the image.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:34> This image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters, destroying multiple vehicles and injuring or killing their crews in October 2024."

## Actions
```
image_search("burning tank Israeli army")
geolocate(<image:34>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
Sky News shows an image of a burning tank (<image:8744>). The search result from vpk.name shows a burning tank (<image:8745>). The source discusses an old photo that is being circulated as showing the destruction of an Israeli military tank in Shamaa, south of Lebanon (<image:8746>).

The sources are:
*   [https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835](https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835)
*   [https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html](https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html)
*   [https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/)


### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Pakistan': 0.11, 'Palestine': 0.11, 'Israel': 0.1, 'Tunisia': 0.09, 'Mexico': 0.06, 'Colombia': 0.05, 'Chile': 0.04, 'Sweden': 0.03, 'Argentina': 0.02, 'Denmark': 0.02}

## Elaboration
The image search results show other images of burning tanks, including one from Sky News. One source discusses an old photo being circulated as showing the destruction of an Israeli military tank in Shamaa, south of Lebanon. The geolocation data suggests the image could have been taken in Palestine or Israel.

The evidence does not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024. The evidence does not provide the date or location of the image.


## Actions
```
web_search("Hamas ambush Israeli tank Jabalia October 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article on the "Siege of North Gaza" mentions fighting in Jabalia, including an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. The Reuters article from October 8, 2024, reports that Israeli tanks pushed into Jabalia. Al Jazeera reports on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, including intense bombardment and tank deployment (<image:1>).


## Elaboration
The web search results provide additional information about the events in Jabalia in October 2024. The Wikipedia article mentions an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. Reuters and Al Jazeera also report on the fighting in Jabalia, including tank deployments.

While the evidence confirms that there was fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including tank deployments and an ambush, it does not confirm that the image depicts the specific event described in the claim. The evidence does not provide any information about the image.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search and web search results provide information about burning tanks and fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, but they do not confirm that the image depicts the specific event described in the claim. The evidence does not provide any information about the image.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/dec/18/jabaliya-refugee-camp-gaza-destruction-idf): 
Content: "As well as the large open market at its centre, there were restaurants and schools, two football teams, bakeries and clinics.

[Satellite map of Jabaliya on 8 Oct 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_8_oct_2023_tue_final/giv-4559YJ4SlWz5oDm0)

[This footage from 2022 shows people on a packed street in the camp’s main market during Eid al-Fitr celebrations.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.mp4)

Between 10.30am and 11.30am on 9 October last year, five Israeli airstrikes tore through the market, killing dozens of people.

[Aftermath of an airstrike in al-Trans area on 9 October 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.mp4)

They were the opening salvoes of a devastating Israeli campaign, conducted in three waves, that has left the camp an unrecognisable wasteland of rubble.

“This year is one of the worst I have experienced,” said 33-year-old Ahlam al-Tlouli, who comes from the Tal al-Zaatar area of the camp. “No house, person, tree or stone was spared.”

‘Jabaliya is like hell’
-----------------------

**The third offensive: October 2024 – ongoing**

The heavy damage inflicted on Jabaliya during the second offensive paled in comparison with the destruction levelled since 5 October, when Israeli forces returned in large numbers for a third time.

Over the course of the offensive – which targeted Jabaliya city as well as the camp – whole groupings of buildings have been demolished, replaced in some areas by bulldozed lanes to accommodate Israeli armour and tank berms. Every minute that passes feels like a year.”

Over the course of the Israeli invasion, settlements across the Gaza Strip have suffered damage.

[Map showing damage to settlements](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabailya_locator_update/giv-45592lvKwJoM9WfY/)

This is the story of the ruin of Jabaliya.

‘We were starving and without food’
-----------------------------------

**The first offensive: October 2023 – January** **2024**

Jabaliya was pummelled with airstrikes in the first months of the war. The deadliest, on 31 October, [killed scores of people](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/jabalia-camp-airstrike-gaza)
 and left large craters in the ground at a busy junction.

[Large craters left in ground after Jabaliya was pummelled with airstrikes on 31 October 2023.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.mp4)

Israel said the camp was a command centre for Hamas’s northern brigade and that it had identified Hamas tunnel systems under the camp. In footage posted online in recent weeks, bulldozers and backhoes can be seen pulling down structures.

[Backhoe used to pull down building in October 2024.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.mp4)

Some neighbourhoods have almost entirely disappeared, including block 4, which included the camp’s main school complex.

[Satellite image of Block 4 in Jabaliya refugee camp](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_block4_sidebyside_tue_final/giv-45591oPngPow70Km/)

“There are bodies on the roads and under the rubble,” said Mahmoud Basal, 39, a civil defence official. “Homes, streets, health and educational facilities – everything is gone.”

‘All the houses were in ruins’
------------------------------

**The second offensive: May 2024**

Intermittent clashes continued throughout January despite Israeli claims that Hamas had been defeated in Jabaliya. This footage from April shows damage to buildings along two roads in the camp.

[Damaged buildings in Jabaliya refugee camp.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.mp4)

On 11 May the IDF reported that Hamas had managed to reconstitute its military capabilities, and it issued a new round of evacuation orders to civilians. Drone footage filmed in June laid bare the extent of the destruction.

[Drone footage showing large swathes of destruction in Jabaliya in June 2024.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops5.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops5.mp4)

Fakhoura district had the worst destruction. At some point during the third offensive the football pitch was cleared out and now appears to host several Israeli military vehicles.

[Satellite images of the Khadamat Jabaliya sports club between 8 Oct 2023 and 12 Nov 2024](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya-football-pitch_tue_final/giv-4559bZWE6jJF9tRM/)

Khaled al-Ayla, a 54-year-old university lecturer, said: “The situation in Jabaliya is like hell."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an article on December 18, 2024, detailing the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp. The article mentions three offensives by Israeli forces, with the third offensive beginning on October 5, 2024. The article includes satellite images and videos showing the destruction, including bulldozed lanes for Israeli armour and tank berms. The article also mentions that the football pitch was cleared out and now appears to host several Israeli military vehicles.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israel-kills-least-40-gaza-tanks-deepen-raid-north-2024-10-15/): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

[Exclusive news, data and analytics for financial market professionalsLearn more aboutRefinitiv](/differentiator/)

*   Summary

*   Israeli strikes kill 50 Palestinians in Gaza
*   Israeli forces tighten siege around Jabalia
*   Israel says it is facilitating humanitarian aid to Jabalia
*   Says it has helped to transfer patients and staff from the north to other hospitals

CAIRO, Oct 15 (Reuters) - Israeli military strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip as Israeli forces tightened their squeeze around Jabalia in the north of the enclave on Tuesday, amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters.

Palestinian health officials said at least 17 people were killed by Israeli fire near Al-Falouja in Jabalia, the largest of Gaza's eight historic refugee camps, while 10 others were killed in Bani Suhaila in eastern Khan Younis in the south when an Israeli missile struck a house.

Sign up [here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=%2Fworld%2Fmiddle-east%2Fisrael-kills-least-40-gaza-tanks-deepen-raid-north-2024-10-15%2F)

Earlier on Tuesday, an Israeli airstrike destroyed three houses in the Sabra suburb of Gaza City, and the local civil emergency service said they recovered two bodies from the site, while the search continued for 12 other people who were believed to have been in the houses at the time.

Eight others were killed when a house was struck in the Nuseirat camp in central Gaza.

The Gaza health ministry said one doctor was killed when he tried to help people wounded by Israeli strikes in Al-Falouja in Jabalia. Residents said Israeli forces destroyed dozens of houses in the past 10 days.

On Tuesday, the Israeli military said troops had killed dozens of fighters in the Jabalia area over the past day, including a unit that fired an anti-tank missile at them.

The United Nations human rights office said the Israeli military appeared to be "cutting off North Gaza completely from the rest of the Gaza Strip."

"Gaza families are facing unimaginable fear, loss of loved ones, confusion, and exhaustion. It said it was facilitating humanitarian, and in particular medical aid to residents.

Item 1 of 5 Palestinians inspect the damage at the site of an Israeli strike on a tent camp sheltering displaced people, amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict, in Al-Mawasi area in Khan Younis, in the southern Gaza Strip, October 15, 2024. REUTERS/Hatem Khaled

REUTERS/Hatem Khaled [Purchase Licensing Rights, opens new tab](https://www.reutersconnect.com/item/aftermath-of-israeli-strike-on-a-tent-camp-sheltering-displaced-people-in-gazas-al-mawasi/dGFnOnJldXRlcnMuY29tLDIwMjQ6bmV3c21sX1JDMlVLQUFVOVNLNg%3D%3D/?utm_medium=rcom-article-media&utm_campaign=rcom-rcp-lead)

Hamas denies it embeds its operatives amongst civilians.

JABALIA ENCIRCLED
-----------------

The Israeli military has now encircled the Jabalia camp and sent tanks into nearby Beit Lahiya and Beit Hanoun towns, with the declared aim of stamping out Hamas fighters who are trying to regroup there.

The Israeli military has told residents to leave their homes and head to safety in southern Gaza. It added that several medics were wounded when their ambulance came under Israeli fire in the northern and southern Gaza Strip.

Jabalia has been the focus of an Israeli offensive for more than 10 days, with troops returning to areas of the north that came under [heavy bombardment](https://www.reuters.com/graphics/ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS/ANNIVERSARY-GAZA-RUBBLE/akveegbnlvr/)
 in the early months of the [year-long war.](https://www.reuters.com/world/israel-hamas/)

The operation has raised concerns among Palestinians and U.N. People must be able to flee safely, without facing further danger," Adrian Zimmerman,

ICRC Gaza head of sub-delegation, said in a statement.

The Israeli military's administrative unit, Cogat, which oversees aid and commercial shipments to Gaza, said on Tuesday that operations in Jabalia were targeting terrorist infrastructure and operatives embedded inside civilian areas. officials say there is no safe place in Gaza.

Hamas' armed wing said fighters were engaged in fierce battles with Israeli forces in and around Jabalia.

Gaza's health ministry said the army ordered the three hospitals operating there to evacuate but medical staffers said they were determined to continue their services.

Cogat said in recent days it had facilitated the transfer of 33 patients, medical staff and accompanying personnel from the Kamal Adwan Hospital in the north to functioning facilities elsewhere in Gaza.

It said it has also provided 68,650 litres of fuel to hospitals and coordinated the delivery of 800 blood transfusion units.

Ismail Al-Thawabta, the director of the Hamas-run Gaza government media office, said Israel was trying to give a misleading impression and that its forces had been preventing ambulance and civil emergency teams from recovering the bodies of dozens of people from the streets.

Hussam Abu Safiya, director of Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of the three hospitals in northern Gaza, said they were facing serious shortages of food, medication, and fuel, that could soon impact patients in their facilities.

"There is a stark shortage of consumables and supplies began to run out. 7 attack on Israel, in which 1,200 people were killed and around 250 taken hostage to Gaza, by Israeli tallies. More than 42,000 Palestinians have been killed in the offensive so far, according to Gaza's health authorities.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

*   [https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835](https://news.sky.com/video/israel-gunfire-heard-as-tank-burns-after-hamas-attack-12978835)
*   [https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html](https://vpk.name/en/783167_atgm-kornet-burned-israeli-tanks-merkava-mk4-back-in-2006.html)
*   [https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/](https://kashif.ps/en/index.php/2024/11/25/old-photo-circulated-as-showing-destruction-of-israeli-military-tank-in-shamaa-south-of-lebanon/)


### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Pakistan': 0.11, 'Palestine': 0.11, 'Israel': 0.1, 'Tunisia': 0.09, 'Mexico': 0.06, 'Colombia': 0.05, 'Chile': 0.04, 'Sweden': 0.03, 'Argentina': 0.02, 'Denmark': 0.02}

## Elaboration
The image search results show other images of burning tanks, including one from Sky News. One source discusses an old photo being circulated as showing the destruction of an Israeli military tank in Shamaa, south of Lebanon. The geolocation data suggests the image could have been taken in Palestine or Israel.

The evidence does not confirm the claim that the image shows an Israeli tank unit near Jabalia camp in northern Gaza that was successfully ambushed by Hamas fighters in October 2024. The evidence does not provide the date or location of the image.


## Actions
```
web_search("Hamas ambush Israeli tank Jabalia October 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article on the "Siege of North Gaza" mentions fighting in Jabalia, including an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. The Reuters article from October 8, 2024, reports that Israeli tanks pushed into Jabalia. Al Jazeera reports on an Israeli ground offensive on Jabalia on October 6, 2024, including intense bombardment and tank deployment (<image:1>).


## Elaboration
The web search results provide additional information about the events in Jabalia in October 2024. The Wikipedia article mentions an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. Reuters and Al Jazeera also report on the fighting in Jabalia, including tank deployments.

While the evidence confirms that there was fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including tank deployments and an ambush, it does not confirm that the image depicts the specific event described in the claim. The evidence does not provide any information about the image.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli tank destroyed Jabalia October 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Guardian published an article on December 18, 2024, detailing the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp, including bulldozed lanes for Israeli armour and tank berms. The article mentions three offensives by Israeli forces, with the third offensive beginning on October 5, 2024. Reuters reported on October 15, 2024, that Israeli forces tightened their squeeze around Jabalia amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters, mentioning that the Israeli military has encircled the Jabalia camp and sent tanks into nearby towns (<image:8750>).


## Elaboration
The web search results confirm that there was fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including the deployment of tanks. However, the evidence does not provide any information about the image. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Final Judgement
The claim cannot be verified because the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts the specific event described in the claim. While the search results confirm that there was fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including tank deployments and an ambush, it does not provide any information about the image. `false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim cannot be verified. While web searches confirm fighting in Jabalia in October 2024, including tank deployments and an ambush, the evidence does not link the provided image to these events. The image search results show other images of burning tanks, but do not confirm the context of the claim.

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:37> This image shows thousands gathering at Sohrawardi Park in Kolkata, India, in April 2025 to show solidarity with the Palestinian people amid the ongoing Israeli assault on Gaza."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Sohrawardi Park Kolkata Palestine protest")
image_search("Sohrawardi Park Kolkata Palestine protest")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:37> This image shows thousands gathering at Sohrawardi Park in Kolkata, India, in April 2025 to show solidarity with the Palestinian people amid the ongoing Israeli assault on Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Sohrawardi Park Kolkata Palestine protest")
image_search("Sohrawardi Park Kolkata Palestine protest")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://factly.in/photos-of-a-protest-held-in-solidarity-with-palestine-in-dhaka-bangladesh-are-falsely-shared-as-those-from-kolkata/): 
Content: "<image:5420> !FACTLY <image:5421>](https://factly.in/ "FACTLY")

[](# "Search")

[](# "Search")

*   [A](# "Decrease font size")
     [A](# "Reset font size")
     [A](# "Increase font size") [Twitter](http://twitter.com/home?status=https%3A%2F%2Ffactly.in%2Fphotos-of-a-protest-held-in-solidarity-with-palestine-in-dhaka-bangladesh-are-falsely-shared-as-those-from-kolkata%2F "Tweet It")
 [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffactly.in%2Fphotos-of-a-protest-held-in-solidarity-with-palestine-in-dhaka-bangladesh-are-falsely-shared-as-those-from-kolkata%2F "Share on Facebook")
 [Reddit](//www.reddit.com/r/india/submit?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffactly.in%2Fphotos-of-a-protest-held-in-solidarity-with-palestine-in-dhaka-bangladesh-are-falsely-shared-as-those-from-kolkata%2F "Share on Reddit")

Amidst the ongoing conflict between Israel and Gaza ([here](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2025/4/22/live-israel-kills-29-in-gaza-netanyahu-vows-powerful-response-to-houthis)
, [here](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c62xnqlj11lo)
), several photos are going viral on social media ([here](https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=pfbid0zeoJLkFniVZBpGVGwgpXqxmEv3rGxp49wKoShbposwvmFdStGfGbF7RuoixfijDMl&id=61572050565351)
, [here](https://x.com/TimeisPalestine/status/1911085598909120827)
, and [here](https://www.facebook.com/search/posts?q=Thousands%20have%20rallied%20in%20Sohrawardi%20Park%2C%20Kolkata%2C%20India%2C&filters=eyJyZWNlbnRfcG9zdHM6MCI6IntcIm5hbWVcIjpcInJlY2VudF9wb3N0c1wiLFwiYXJnc1wiOlwiXCJ9In0%3D)
) with the claim that they show thousands rallying at Sohrawardi Park in Kolkata, India, in solidarity with the Palestinian people. <image:5422>

The archived post can be found [here](https://mvau.lt/media/87590edd-9937-42d7-8f0d-9f80c9994938)
.

> **Claim:** The photos show thousands rallying in solidarity with the Palestinian people at Sohrawardi Park in Kolkata, India.
> 
> **Fact**: The viral photos actually show a protest held at Suhrawardy Udyan in Dhaka, Bangladesh, on 12 April 2025. <image:5425>

To sum up, photos of a protest held in solidarity with Palestine in Dhaka, Bangladesh, are falsely shared as those from Kolkata.

Next Article [ಮಾರ್ಚ್ 2025 ರಲ್ಲಿ ಮಧ್ಯಪ್ರದೇಶದ ಎರಡು ಸಮುದಾಯಗಳ ನಡುವೆ ನಡೆದ ಬಕ್ತರಾ ಗ್ರಾಮದ ಗಲಭೆಯ ವೀಡಿಯೊವನ್ನು ಪಶ್ಚಿಮ ಬಂಗಾಳದ ಕೋಮು ಘಟನೆ ಎಂದು ತಪ್ಪಾಗಿ ಹಂಚಿಕೊಳ್ಳಲಾಗುತ್ತಿದೆ](https://factly.in/kannada-a-video-of-the-baktara-village-riots-between-two-communities-in-madhya-pradesh-in-march-2025-is-being-falsely-shared-as-a-communal-incident-from-west-bengal/)

### About Author

! The caption stated that it was a “March for Gaza,” mentioning that millions had gathered at Sohrawardi Park in the procession, with the entire area echoing with slogans.

! <image:5423>

According to reports ([here](https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/dhaka/378474/march-for-gaza-crowds-march-from-zero-point-to)
, [here](https://www.tbsnews.net/bangladesh/people-gathering-suhrawardy-udyan-attend-march-gaza-rally-1113766)
, and [here](https://apnews.com/article/bangladesh-israel-protest-gaza-05fd8885dd27c045756a233c9f5ff335)
) dated 12 April 2025, a massive crowd marched from Gulistan’s Zero Point to Suhrawardy Park in Dhaka as part of the “March for Gaza” programme to show solidarity with Palestinians. The event, known as the “March for Gaza,” attracted approximately 100,000 participants who gathered to protest against Israel’s actions in the Gaza Strip. The photos have no connection to Kolkata, India. [Around](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lwhl4HghqrA)
 100,000 people had gathered at Suhrawardy Park in the Dhaka University area to condemn Israel’s actions in the Gaza Strip.

!"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Factly states that the photos in the claim are from a protest held in Suhrawardy Udyan in Dhaka, Bangladesh, on April 12, 2025, and not in Kolkata, India. <image:5422>, <image:5425>. The event was a "March for Gaza" to show solidarity with Palestinians, with approximately 100,000 participants.

_________________________

 [Email](mailto:?subject=Images%20of%20demonstration%20in%20solidarity%20with%20Palestine%20from%20Bangladesh%20circulate%20as%20from%20India&body=https%3A%2F%2Fkashif.ps%2Fen%2Findex.php%2F2025%2F04%2F14%2Fimages-of-demonstration-in-solidarity-with-palestine-from-bangladesh-circulate-as-from-india%2F "Email")

[A group of photos](https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=pfbid034RDKFiHukQUTV98jNoWB47UMiiMy5mjuAw8g1BuaexMrrb1raDJN8dneKzEALD7ul&id=61572050565351)
 of a solidarity march with Palestine have been circulating on social media, claiming that they are from a demonstration in Kolkata, India. The photos were accompanied by the following description: “Thousands of people demonstrated in Suhrawardy Park in Kolkata, India, in solidarity with the Palestinian people in light of the ongoing Israeli genocide in Gaza.” 

[! The images are from a demonstration in which thousands of citizens took to the streets in the Bangladeshi capital, Dhaka, in solidarity with Palestine, not in India.

[Somoynews.tv](http://somoynews.tv/)
 Facebook account posted a series of photos with the following description: “March for Gaza. The demonstration was organized by the Palestine Solidarity Movement. 

The Israeli occupation’s aggression against the Gaza Strip continues. According to the latest update from [the Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza](https://www.facebook.com/MOHGaza1994/posts/pfbid02qvPKac7iAAwMXPr6khxgxuToea71tEV4o7V4DUp79PE5qVjKMLosLmdwfHcESoiHl)
, the death toll from the aggression on the Gaza Strip since 7/10/2023, has risen to 50,944 and 116,156 injuries, including 15,000 children killed, and more than 34,000 other children injured.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Kashif, published on April 14, 2025, discusses images of a demonstration in solidarity with Palestine. The images were falsely claimed to be from Kolkata, India, but are actually from Dhaka, Bangladesh. <image:5433>, <image:5436>. The demonstration was organized by the Palestine Solidarity Movement. The article also mentions the ongoing Israeli aggression against Gaza.
